wiki.content:
"More Blues" is the tenth track on Pink Floyd's 1969 album, "Soundtrack from the Film More". It is an instrumental track that runs two minutes and twelve seconds long. The song is one of Pink Floyd's very few recorded blues pieces. 
 
 "More Blues" is credited to the entire band. Pink Floyd would play a variation of this piece live occasionally from 1970-72, and notably as the final encore of their performance in Montreal in 1977 (the last show of the Animals tour) with Floyd's touring guitarist Snowy White playing lead guitar in David Gilmour's place after Gilmour left the stage disgruntled.
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "More Blues" is the tenth track on Pink Floyd's 1969 album, "Soundtrack from the Film More". It is an instrumental track that runs two minutes and twelve seconds long. The song is one of Pink Floyd's very few recorded blues pieces.   "More Blues" is credited to the entire band. Pink Floyd would play a variation of this piece live occasionally from 1970-72, and notably as the final encore of their performance in Montreal in 1977 (the last show of the Animals tour) with Floyd's touring guitarist Snowy White playing lead guitar in David Gilmour's place after Gilmour left the stage disgruntled.

track.name: More Blues
comments: pink floyd?  thought they forgot all about 'em....
who would've known, a band that hardly ever played the blues, came up with this masterpiece
So soothing...it's like floating down a river.
A rare 12-bar blues tune by the Floyd. "Pink Blues" (available on live bootlegs) is another great one.
love the way the drums slowly come in
9 minute version is on more blues archives (1970). good early live stuff
Terrific.  Could be a bit longer though.
